page.title: 10FARMING
page.content: Farming in the area is mainly dairy with some beef rearing and a few sheep .The dairy herds graze out in summer and are in enclosed yards in winter with a cubicle shed to lie in.They are fed on silage.Some concentrates in nut form are given at milking time which is morning and night.The two main milking systems are herring_bone and carousel.A herd of 60 to 100 milking cows is average,mostly Fresians.The milk is collected each morning by tanker.The milk is kept cool in a bulk milk tank at the farm.A paddle rotates in the milk when the temperature rises.The milk goes to the Milk Marketing Board to be processed. Most milk is delivered to the doorstep in pint bottles.
